name: Document Title: CHK-002-CIV-Stormwater Drainage Pits Installation
Check list Description: Stormwater Drainage Pits Installation
ITP created by: Jon De Castro
ITP approved for use by: Aldrin Guinchoma
1. Pits are set-out in accordance to IFC Drawings and Section 701.10 with the following tolerances below.
(a) offset of entry pits required to match lines of  kerbs or barriers ±20 mm
(b) plan location of pits other than offsets to kerb lines or barriers ±100 mm
(c) invert level of Pits at pits ±50 mm
(d) departure from design grade of pipe runs ±10 mm in 10 m provided minimum grade is not less than 1:250
1. Excavation depth as indicated on the IFC Drawings
2. For precast pits the excavation to have minimum clearance of 400mm from face of the excavation
Minimum clearance from all faces of pit to face of excavation:
Bedding conforming to to 701.09 shall be supplied, placed and compacted to a thickness:
1. Tested minimum of 20% of all lots for each culvert. (Lot = 1 layer of bedding).
2. Bedding compacted to refusal by hand held mechanical equipment & material (Swell ≥ 2.5%) mean moisture ratio of 92%  between the completion of rolling and the placement of overlaying laye.
Responsible Engineer to confirm if the bedding testing is required for this lot.
5 - Pits - Placement of Precast Drainage Pit
1. Pits phycially checked and confirmed No Damage prior to install
– Plan location of pits, other than offsets to kerb line or barriers, to be +/- 100mm
– Offset of entry pits required to match lines of  kerbs or barriers ±20 mm
6 - Pits - Cast in Place Drainage Pit
1. Cast in place drainage pits shall be constructed at locations and to the dimensions shown on the IFC Drawings and in accordance with Sections 610 and 611.
2. Cast in place drainage pits shall not be constructed with fibre reinforced concrete (FRC).
1. All connections to drainage pits neatly made in accordance with Section 705.11.
2. Openings into drainage pit walls neatly saw cut to the required size not more than 50mm greater than pipe diameter.
3. Breaking out of holes is not permitted.
4. Drainage pits to be replaced if cracking occurs as a result of installing holes or if the hole exceeds the pipe diameter by more than 50 mm.
5. Exposed reinforcement to be coated with an approved epoxy treatment to prevent corrosion prior to rendering around the pipes.
1. Drainage pit floors smoothly shaped from the inlets to the outlet for a height of one‑third of the diameter of the outlet pipe with cementitious mortar in accordance with Section 705.13.
1. Drainage pits greater than 1.0m deep fitted with step irons in accordance with 705.12.
2. Ladder rungs to not obstruct openings and that water does not discharge on them.
3. Step rungs do not come within 50mm of the top of the riser.
4. Step irons of an approved proprietary type shall be installed in accordance with the manufacturer's instructions.
1. Frames for drainage pit covers to be cast into the top of the drainage pit or bedded on fresh mortar, 5 mm thick, consisting of two parts of sand, one part of cement.
2. Height within 10mm of the design level.
1. All stormwater pits to be provided with locakable pit lid minimum Class D with in-fill material or fibre glass Terra Firm Enduro or similar.
1. Backfilling around drainage pits placed in layers not exceeding 300 mm loose thickness and compacted to refusal using hand held mechanical equipment.
